data.title: Xero Accounting
data.meta_description: Advance your accounting skills with this TAFE Queensland short course. Learn how to set up and maintain day-to-day business operations using Xero accounting.
data.text:
Course overview

This course includes set up, conversion, payroll, advanced procedures and day-to-day operations and is suitable for anyone requiring working knowledge of Xero operations. It gives you confidence that you have the skills to operate Xero within your business structure or to gain employment as an accounts clerk using Xero Accounting and Payroll. You will need prior knowledge of basic accounting terminology before enrolling in this course. This is an interactive course where questions are welcome.

Topics include:

Navigating Xero Accounting

Bank feeds and reconciliations

Cash coding

Set up a Xero company file

Conversion dates and importing balances

Setting up and importing chart of accounts

Setting up customer and supplier cards

Setting up inventory and tracking

Import a bank statement

Perform a bank reconciliation

Code payments through spend money

Code and allocate cash receipts

Create quotes, orders and invoices

Process and issue credit notes

Record customer payments

Deal with bad debts

Process purchases

Record and code supplier payments

GST reporting and overview

Work with reports

Complete a Business Activity Statement (BAS) using Xero

End of year procedures

Setting up payroll

Set up employees cards

Implementing tracking against employees

Processing a payroll

Advanced procedures

This short course is non-accredited therefore is not registered with the National Training Register.
